dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Ng, H.H. 2010. Batasio batasio. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: This species is known from the Brahmaputra River drainage of India and Bangladesh. It has been reported from the Ganges River drainage also, but these records need to be verified as they might refer to B. macronotus.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution

dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Ng, H.H. 2010. Batasio batasio. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Ng, H.H.

Reviewer/s
Chaudhry, S., Pal, M. & Molur, S.

Contributor/s
Molur, S.

Justification
Although fragmentary catch data suggests a significant decline in the population of this species over a period of four decades from a small portion of its distribution, current information from the ornamental fish trade suggests that this species is still relatively abundant in the core area of its range in Brahmaputra River in Assam. Batasio batasio is therefore assessed here as Least Concern.
